props.synopsis: A man in his 50s has been taken to Liverpool Hospital with stab wounds and three others are being treated at the scene, NSW Ambulance says.

title.children: Man in custody, four people injured in alleged stabbing incident at Sydney church

image.altText: A man walks out of glass doors flanked by a lawyer and journalists.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case againstÂ Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson over coverage of Brittany Higgins's rape allegation has failed. Here are the five key takeaways from Federal Court Justice Michael Lee's judgment.

title.children: Five key takeways from Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case in the Federal Court

image.altText: Bruce looks serious as he walks through a throng of reporters, wearing suit and tie.

props.synopsis: For the first time, a court has made findings against Bruce Lehrmann, but the dust from today's judgment in his defamation case has yet to settle.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case captivated tens of thousands, but it nearly didn't happen

image.altText: A man with a long grey beard and wearing a hat.

props.synopsis: The parents of Joel Cauchi describe their son as tormented after he killed six people and wounded several others at Bondi Junction on the weekend.

title.children: 'I'm sorry he's done this to the nation': Andrew Cauchi breaks down speaking about killer son

image.altText: A collage including photos of the Bondi Junction attacker and a young man in the bush, and a tweet.

props.synopsis: For 14 hours over the weekend, Sydney university student Ben Cohen was one of the most reviled men on the internet, falsely accused of the Bondi Junction stabbings. Here's how the lie spread around the world.

title.children: Ben was falsely accused of stabbing six people to death. Here's how this falsehood spread

image.altText: two people face building with police tape

props.synopsis: In the information vacuum immediately following the mass stabbing at Bondi Junction over the weekend, the alt right exploited the opportunity to spread disinformation and hatred on a favourite, lawless social media platform.Â

title.children: How does an ideologically motivated lie travel from alt-right internet backwaters to a national newsroom?

image.altText: Two people embrace near floral tributes outside Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Bondi Junction Westfield is somewhere people take their kids to the movies on the weekends and teenagers hang out with their friends. Now, people are struggling to process how a mundane trip to the shops has ended in the violent deaths of six people.Â

title.children: 'Shopping will be a different experience': Sydney reels after attack where everyday life happens

image.altText: An atmospheric photo of a quarry with hexagonal columns of rock.

props.synopsis: The three Bangladeshi tourists were taking photos at the instafamous Bombo Headland Quarry rock ledge when a large wave washed them into the ocean.

title.children: Overseas tourist drowns after being swept into the sea while taking photos on Bombo rock ledge

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Lawrence Wong pose for photos shaking hands.

props.synopsis: In the more than 58 years that Singapore has been an independent nation, Australia has had 17 prime ministers, while the island nation has had just three. So, what can we expect from Lawrence Wong when the deputy leader takes over from Lee Hsien Loong next month?

title.children: Who is Lawrence Wong, the man poised to become Singaporeâs fourth prime minister, on a $2.5m salary?

image.altText: Dozens of protesters lie down on the corner of Spencer and Bourke streets.

props.synopsis: Protesters rallying against Israel's actions in Gaza have caused disruptions in Melbourne and Brisbane as part of a worldwide demonstration.Â

title.children: Protesters accused of tampering with traffic lights as 14 people arrested in Melbourne Gaza rallies

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee has delivered his judgment in the defamation case brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson, ruling thatÂ the evidence hadÂ proven Network Ten's substantial truth defence.

title.children: Judge rules that Bruce Lehrmann raped Brittany Higgins 'without caring whether she consented'

image.altText: A woman in a tracksuit jacket cries in front of a police barricade at Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Westfield Bondi Junction will open 'within a week' following the stabbing deaths of six people on Saturday, but an investigation into what happened could take months.

title.children: Bondi Junction attacker 'focused on women and avoided the men', police commissioner says

image.altText: A child watches television

props.synopsis: How do you talk to children about the horror of the stabbings when you struggle to process it yourself.

title.children: How to talk to children about the trauma of the Bondi Junction stabbings

image.altText: A man wearing a hat and jacket

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old former Test batsman is being held on the Gold Coast over a range charges including assault and one count of breaching bail.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater in custody facing stalking, strangulation charges

image.altText: combined image of four undated supplied images shows Bondi Junction stabbing victims

props.synopsis: Six people, including five women, have been confirmed dead after a stabbing attack in a busy Sydney shopping centre on Saturday. Here's what we know about those who died.

title.children: Who are the victims of the Bondi Junction stabbing attack?

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann leaves Federal Court in Sydney, surrounded by people, looking serious

props.synopsis: The Federal Court finds, on the balance of probabilities, that Bruce Lehrmann did rape Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019. Look back on what happened.

title.children: Lehrmann defamation case against Network Ten fails after judge finds 'substantial truth' to story â as it happened

image.altText: A person sitting in a garden preparing food

props.synopsis: Best known as the TV host of Consuming Passions and a long-time advocate for the food, wine, and culture of Margaret River and the South West of WA, Parmenter passed away over the weekend.

title.children: ABC TV chef and broadcaster Ian Parmenter of Consuming Passions dies aged 79

image.altText: Players and fans standing for silence to remember victims of Bondi Junction attack

props.synopsis: Football Australia is investigating a spectator who appeared to perform a Nazi salute during the A-League derby clash between Western Sydney Wanderers and Sydney FC.

title.children: FA investigate alleged Nazi salute during A-League derby

image.altText: A dog sleeping with a magpie on it's back

props.synopsis: The Insta-famous magpie that forged a friendship with a Staffordshire terrier pup is returned to the family that raised it without the required permits.

title.children: 'Wiggly bottoms' and cries of happiness as Molly the magpie is reunited with Gold Coast family and canine pal

image.altText: Karen Brock from Brocklands nursery and garden supplies

props.synopsis: Suppliers of garden plants to Australia's biggest hardware chain are reporting treatment from the company allegedly so severe that the resulting stress on nursery owners has broken up marriages and left some feeling like "slaves" and "serfs".

title.children: 'I thought it would kill me': Bunnings suppliers break silence about hardware chain's strategy

image.altText: A man with sunglasses and an umbrella side profile

props.synopsis: A nurse whose husband was one of two people killed in central Queensland crash has told a truck driver he took away her family's "extraordinary man" in an instant.

title.children: Wife's devastation laid bare as truck driver jailed for deadly ambulance crash

image.altText: Sarah Snook with Olivier Award

props.synopsis: Snook has won best actress at the Olivier Awards in London for her performance in Sydney Theatre Company and Michael Cassel Group's The Picture of Dorian Gray.

title.children: Sarah Snook wins Olivier Award for playing Dorian Gray and 25 other characters in London

image.altText: Three men stand around a black rocket booster in a sandy environment.

props.synopsis: Iran's deployment of drones and missiles towards Israel represented a big shift in what had been a shadow war fought through Iran's proxies. The big question now is, what will Israel do in response?

title.children: The shift in Iran and Israel's shadow war marks a dangerous moment for the world

image.altText: Bondi Junction Stabbing Rampage

props.synopsis: NSW's police commissioner says it's "obvious" from CCTV the Bondi attacker "focused on women and avoided the men" as the prime minister applauds the actions of people who responded.

title.children: PM applauds Australians' 'heroism' amid Bondi stabbings, NSW premier says baby's condition has improved â as it happened

image.altText: Lithuania's Mykolas Alekna preparing to throw his discus during a major event

props.synopsis: Lithuanian powerhouseÂ Mykolas AleknaÂ took advantage of windy conditions in the unlikely setting of Ramona, Oklahoma, to set a new mark of 74.35 metres.

title.children: Long-standing men's discus world record broken ahead of Olympic Games

image.altText: Collage of Taylor Swift, incognito mode with hat, Grimes DJ'ing in sunglasses and Gwen Stefani with Olivia Rodrigo.

props.synopsis: Plus, other entertainment news you might have missed, including Ryan Gosling's best SNL sketches, the NGV's Yayoi Kusama retrospective and more.

title.children: 'Forgive me!': Grimes apologises after disappointing Coachella set, plus the surprises and flops of weekend one

image.altText: Copy of Copy of NRLR5

props.synopsis: Between two golden point games, the drama around South Sydney, and a new rule landing firmly in the spotlight, round six in the NRL was another dramatic one. Here's our Round-Up for this week.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Golden points galore and the emergence of Shawn Blore

image.altText: A close-up shot of a woman's hand holding a mobile phone showing the Hybrid Reserve website.

props.synopsis: Australians are losing millions to international fraud syndicates posting fake ads on social media. One woman who lost more than $100,000 after being "brainwashed" is determined to stop it from happening to others.

title.children: Australians are losing their life savings to a massive fraud syndicate. This 'furious' victim wants to stop others being burned

image.altText: A man and woman sit in dimly lit room with mugs in front of them, both smiling and looking down.

props.synopsis: Crushes can strike at work, on the bus or between life-long friends. The choice to share your feelings comes with a raft of risks and vulnerabilities.

title.children: 'Now we're married': When Kate shared her secret crush, it had a happy ending. That's not always the case

image.altText: A woman wearing a red long sleeved top looks over her shoulder at the camera smiling.

props.synopsis: A man who fatally stabbed his ex-partner in front of their three children was wanted by police for months, but wasn't arrested until she was dead.

title.children: Inquest into the murder of Noeline Dalzell hears police failed to protect her from violent ex-partner

image.altText: Piumetharshika Kaneshan

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposed changes to migration law are "entirely incompatible with human rights" and the government should abandon its bill, human rights groups have told a Senate committee scrutinising the legislation.

title.children: Human rights groups air concerns and personal testimonies on government migration bill

image.altText: AFL player Jeremy Finlayson, following through with a kick on his left foot, during a match

props.synopsis: Richard Goyder has defended the AFL's decision to suspend Jeremy Finlayson for uttering a homophobic slur despite allowing Alastair Clarkson to continue coaching following a similar incident.

title.children: AFL Commission chair defends league amid accusations of double standards for slur punishments
